issue.title: Could not load liboqs shared library in fedora 36
issue.body:
@vsoftco @dstebila @baentsch I followed the instructions in liboqs python wrapper to install as a shared library (make -GNinja -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..). Then I cloned liboqs-python and setup a venv called test inside. I then installed setup.py. I then tried to run the kem example with python3 examples/kem.py but the code breaks because it could not load the liboqs library. I have tried multiple variants of liboqs shared library command but I have not gotten any of them to work. Am I doing something wrong or missing a step?

i am using fedora 36 with openssl-devel package instead of libssl-dev , everything compiles really well and checked env and followed all precaution measures in issue #28

comment.body:
ls $PYTHONPATH displays contents of liboqs-python folder and additionally build , dist ,  liboqs-python.egg-info folders

ls $LD_LIBRARY_PATH displays ls: cannot access ':/usr/local/lib': no such file or directory

ldd $LD_LIBRARY_PATH/liboqs.so also gives no such file or directory.

issue.title: Could not load liboqs shared library in fedora 36
issue.body:
@vsoftco @dstebila @baentsch I followed the instructions in liboqs python wrapper to install as a shared library (make -GNinja -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..). Then I cloned liboqs-python and setup a venv called test inside. I then installed setup.py. I then tried to run the kem example with python3 examples/kem.py but the code breaks because it could not load the liboqs library. I have tried multiple variants of liboqs shared library command but I have not gotten any of them to work. Am I doing something wrong or missing a step?

i am using fedora 36 with openssl-devel package instead of libssl-dev , everything compiles really well and checked env and followed all precaution measures in issue #28

comment.body:
Well, then you have the answer to your question: You did not install `liboqs`, i.e., did not run `ninja install` as per https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-python#pre-requisites. 

Alternatively, find the location of `liboqs.so` on your machine and point `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` to that directory.

issue.title: Could not load liboqs shared library in fedora 36
issue.body:
@vsoftco @dstebila @baentsch I followed the instructions in liboqs python wrapper to install as a shared library (make -GNinja -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..). Then I cloned liboqs-python and setup a venv called test inside. I then installed setup.py. I then tried to run the kem example with python3 examples/kem.py but the code breaks because it could not load the liboqs library. I have tried multiple variants of liboqs shared library command but I have not gotten any of them to work. Am I doing something wrong or missing a step?

i am using fedora 36 with openssl-devel package instead of libssl-dev , everything compiles really well and checked env and followed all precaution measures in issue #28

issue.title: adding memory leak testing
issue.body:
Fixes #1213 -- excluding "Classic-McEliece-8192128" as it fails the memory leak test. Open to suggestions how to otherwise handle / document this failure: Draft PR until then.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: Oops -- On another machine (and CI), all Classic-McEliece algorithms now fail (in PQCLEAN_MCELIECE348864_AVX_controlbits) this new test as well as all Dilithium-AES variants (in oqs_aes256_load_schedule_ni)....

But i get compile error.

issue.title: Unable to cross compile liboqs for windows in ubuntu 18.04
issue.body:
Followed instructions on https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling-on-debianubuntu-linux-for-windows and also installed dependencies mentioned in https://openquantumsafe.org/liboqs/getting-started.html for ubuntu . But i get compile error.
![compileerror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82881725/175820155-d2d64247-342f-4397-842e-cc73e7be5a21.png)

comment.body: Can you please provide the complete `cmake` command you issued? Looking at the code I wonder... can you please retry with the `cmake` parameter `-DOQS_DIST_BUILD=ON`? To get a clean slate, be sure to wipe the build directory before.
